skill.name: notion-knowledge-capture
skill.description: Capture conversations and decisions into structured Notion pages; use when turning chats/notes into wiki entries, how-tos, decisions, or FAQs with proper linking.
skill.summary: Capture conversations and decisions into structured Notion pages; use when turning chats/notes into ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only workflow guidance and instructions for using Notion MCP tools. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, and no external command execution. The skill provides structured prompts to help users capture knowledge into Notion.

content.user_title: Capture conversations into structured Notion pages
content.value_statement: Transforming chats and notes into organized wiki entries is time-consuming and often results in inconsistent documentation. This skill provides a structured workflow to capture conversations into linkable Notion pages with proper templates, tags, and relations.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through a 5-step workflow for Notion knowledge capture
Structure conversations into decision logs, how-tos, FAQs, and wiki entries
Create pages with proper schema including tags, owners, status, and dates
Link related pages and establish relations in Notion databases
Update existing pages with new context and track changes
Provide templates for different content types (wiki, how-to, FAQ, decision log)
limitations: Requires Notion MCP to be configured and authenticated
Cannot access Notion without proper MCP connection
Does not create pages automatically; guides users through the process
Relies on user-provided source content and target database selection

use_cases.title: Convert meeting notes to documentation
use_cases.description: Turn meeting transcripts and discussions into structured how-to guides and technical documentation in Notion databases.

use_cases.title: Record architectural decisions
use_cases.description: Capture design decisions with alternatives considered, rationale, and outcomes in a decision log database.

use_cases.title: Build team knowledge bases
use_cases.description: Organize scattered notes and conversations into a searchable wiki with proper linking and categorization.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Capture
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me capture this conversation into a structured Notion page. What type of content is this (decision, how-to, FAQ, wiki entry, or learning note)? What is the target audience and purpose?

prompt_templates.title: Decision Log
prompt_templates.prompt: We need to document this architectural decision in our Notion decision log. Identify the alternatives we discussed, the rationale for our choice, and the expected outcomes. Use the decision log database template.

prompt_templates.title: Update Existing Page
prompt_templates.scenario: Add context to existing Notion page
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch the existing Notion page about [topic] using notion-search and notion-fetch. Then help me add new context, update the status, and link related resources.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Page Knowledge Hub
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a set of linked Notion pages for [topic area]. Use the team wiki database. Include a hub page with relations to sub-topics, set up proper tags and owners, and create a summary for future readers.

output_examples.input: Help me capture our discussion about switching to PostgreSQL into our team wiki.
output: I'll guide you through capturing this decision. First, let's clarify: This is a technical decision for your team wiki, correct?
Key elements I'll help you capture: alternatives considered (PostgreSQL vs MySQL vs MongoDB), the rationale for choosing PostgreSQL, and expected outcomes.
I'll use the team wiki database template. You'll need to set the owner, tags (database, migration, infrastructure), and status.
After creation, I'll help you link this to related pages about our current database setup and migration planning.

best_practices: Always clarify content type, audience, and purpose before starting to capture knowledge.
Use the appropriate database template for each content type (wiki, how-to, FAQ, decision log).
Include relations and backlinks to connect new pages with existing knowledge hub entries.
anti_patterns: Creating pages without checking for existing related content first.
Skipping the schema properties like tags, owners, and status that enable filtering.
Failing to link new pages to hub pages or related documentation, leaving them orphaned.

faq.question: Which Notion databases does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports team wiki, how-to guides, FAQs, decision logs, learning notes, and general documentation databases.

faq.question: What properties should I include when creating pages?
faq.answer: Include title, tags, owner, status, date, and relations as required by your database schema. Check reference guides for specifics.

faq.question: How do I set up the Notion MCP?
faq.answer: Run 'codex mcp add notion --url https://mcp.notion.com/mcp', enable remote MCP client, then authenticate with 'codex mcp login notion'.

faq.question: Is my data safe when capturing to Notion?
faq.answer: The skill only guides the capture process. All data goes directly through your authenticated Notion MCP connection.

faq.question: Can I update existing Notion pages with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. Use Notion:notion-search to find the page, notion-fetch to retrieve it, then notion-update-page to modify content.

faq.question: How is this different from manual Notion creation?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured workflow ensuring consistency, proper linking, and complete metadata across all captured knowledge.
